content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very pleasant problem, well explained.
Please just explain that we don't have to check for the country code to represent a valid country, and that you are using a simplified version to the real-life IBAN validating. The wikipedia page is a bit confusing if not.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very well explained puzzle, balanced regarding fun/difficulty wise. The only pointer I have is regarding the country code, I'm assuming that is any combination of 2 alphabetic characters. I would advise adding just a little explanation of "is a combination of any 2 alphabet characters" because some people may get confused if they are not sure what country code is referring to here. It's not necessary, but it would add value.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple, nice and clear puzzle!

Binary output issue
* According to the contribution guidelines, binary output should be avoided for clashes. As your clash accepts only two possible answers (either "True" or "False"), it suffers from the binary output issue. Please change the output requirement so that there are more than two possible answers in total.

Title
* Please fix the typo: Valdiation => Validation

Goal
* Please change "a IBAN" to "an IBAN".

* Modulus 97 check: Steps 1 and 2 here are not in the same order as the order of the corresponding code (you move the characters first before converting the letters there). If the statement is correct, then what "the first 4 characters" refer to is confusing (the first 4 converted digits?).

Thanks.

Thanks for your feedback!
How do I correctly "add" the different output options, e.g. IBAN is valid, IBAN is too long/short etc.?
I fixed the typos and changed the order in my solution :D

Thank you.

You can explain in Goal section the possible error messages, and then in Output section, mention that the output should be the valid message, or one of the error messages.
And how do I format this?

You may refer to the Goal and Output sections of this example for the formatting:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/63685972d85b55e95b6001680e139cb5a8f2

Thanks, I tried my best to add all your feedback :D

Thanks a lot again for giving constructive feedback!

Yes, that's better now. Further comments:

Goal
* Please fix the typo: unvalid => invalid (twice).

* Please format the following as {{constants}}:

  • true
  
  • IBAN is too long/short
  
  • IBAN does not start with a country code
  
  • IBAN contains special characters

Output
* Please fix the typo: unvalid => invalid.

Constraints
* Please mention that all letters in [[iban]] are in uppercase only.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar. Hence, please include an additional validator for "Too Short" and an additional test for "Too Long".

* Suggest to add one more pair of cases where the IBAN is valid.

* Suggest to add one new pair of cases where the IBAN is invalid because it does not pass the modulus 97 check. If this suggestion is adopted, the list of reasons should be updated accordingly.

Thanks.
